content.raw:
In DART, we have a strict convention that `Skeleton::getJoint(0)` will return the root joint. Also, for cases where there may be multiple trees, you can get the *i*-th root by calling `Skeleton::getRootJoint(i)` where the default value for `i` is `0`, so if you only have one tree in your Skeleton, you can rely on `Skeleton::getRootJoint()` with no arguments to return the single root joint of the Skeleton.

Using that function should be much more general than assuming that the root joint will have the name "root".
